description: 'Dhurandhar' starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna has achieved a new box office record for seventh-week collections, surpassing 'Stree 2'. Despite a dip in daily earnings, the film's impressive net collection of Rs 826.41 crore solidifies its status as the highest-grossing single-language release, inching closer to the Rs 1,000 crore milestone.

title: Former caregiver kills elderly woman in Kolkata, detained
‘Will kill you’: Gurgaon doctor reverses, accelerates, runs over Swiggy rider; caught on CCTV
description: A 41-year-old Ayurvedic doctor was arrested for attempting to murder a Swiggy delivery rider in Gurgaon. The doctor, Naveen, repeatedly rammed his SUV into the rider, Tinku, after a dispute over parking. CCTV footage captured the shocking incident, leading to Naveen's arrest and the seizure of his vehicle.

title: NFL fans roast Josh Allen after Bills loss as Hailee Steinfeld jokes go viral
description: Josh Allen became a viral talking point after Buffalo’s playoff loss to Denver, with fans mixing football frustration and pop culture humor. Social media tied his overtime mistake to buzz around his fiancée Hailee Steinfeld, creating jokes that blended the Bills’ early exit with Hollywood references, turning postseason heartbreak into internet comedy.

Scientists plan to build a graviton detector. Why is it so hard?
description: Gravity is one of nature’s four fundamental forces; the others are electromagnetism and the strong and weak nuclear forces. And gravity is 1 billion billion billion billion times weaker than the electromagnetic force, the next strongest. This is why a fridge magnet can overcome the gravitational pull of the entire earth to pick up a paperclip

title: Heat vs Warriors injury report: Injured & questionable players, stats and more
description: The Miami Heat face the Golden State Warriors on January 19, 2026, with both teams battling significant injuries. Miami's backcourt is depleted, placing more pressure on Bam Adebayo and Norman Powell. Golden State, despite missing key players, is favored at home, with Draymond Green's status being crucial for their defensive edge.

Noida techie death: CEO removed as CM Yogi orders SIT probe; report due in 5 days
description: Following a software engineer's tragic drowning in a waterlogged trench, Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister has taken serious notice. Lokesh M, CEO of Noida Authority, has been removed, and an SIT formed to investigate the incident. The victim's car plunged into the trench at a hazardous, unmarked turn in Sector 150, with rescue efforts critically delayed.

description: Nitin Nabin is set to become the BJP's national president, emerging as the sole candidate with widespread backing from top party leaders, including PM Modi. This marks a historic moment as the party's president has always been a consensus choice.

description: Pakistan has halted preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026, backing Bangladesh's refusal to play in India due to security concerns. Islamabad has indicated it may withdraw if the issue isn't resolved, following Bangladesh's withdrawal from the IPL. The ICC is reluctant to shift Bangladesh's matches, potentially leading to Scotland's replacement.

title: 'No matter who you are': Rohit's 'real hunger' questioned after poor series
description: Rohit Sharma’s poor run continued with an 11-run dismissal in the deciding ODI against New Zealand on Sunday, raising questions about his form and motivation. Now playing only ODIs, Rohit struggled throughout the series, prompting Simon Doull to question whether the 2027 World Cup is too distant to drive him. Doull also cited limited ODI cricket as a factor. Virat Kohli topped the series with 240 runs.

Google AI CEO's 'bombshell': OpenAI's ChatGPT can't invent science; here's why
description: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis argues that large language models like ChatGPT are hitting a wall in achieving true scientific breakthroughs. He believes they lack a 'world model' to understand causality, unlike DeepMind's systems that simulate reality. This perspective challenges OpenAI's scaling strategy amid industry shifts and a race for advanced AI.

title: MLB trade rumours: Mets could add $10M Phillies star before deadline
description: The New York Mets are looking for outfield help this season. They traded Brandon Nimmo to Texas. Now, Max Kepler is a target for a one-year deal. Kepler offers defense and power. This move keeps payroll in check. It also allows younger players to develop. The Mets aim to stay competitive.

title: Matthew Stafford’s family turns heads in Chicago with matching Rams style
description: Matthew Stafford and the Los Angeles Rams braved snowy Chicago for an NFC clash against the Bears. Despite an MVP-worthy season with 4,707 yards and 46 touchdowns, Stafford has never won the award. His wife Kelly and their four daughters cheered him on in matching custom Rams jackets, highlighting their family support as Stafford pursues his second Super Bowl in his 17th NFL season.

title: 'I love museums, but not living in one': Quote of the day by Apple CEO Tim Cook;
description: Apple CEO Tim Cook's quote, "I love museums. But I don't want to live in one," emphasizes the importance of honoring the past while actively pursuing future progress. This philosophy guides leadership and business strategy, advocating for innovation and adaptation over stagnation, even amidst past successes. The simple yet profound message resonates universally, encouraging continuous growth and forward momentum.

title: Bill Belichick joins ESPN as UNC looks ahead after disappointing 4–8 season
description: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.
